metadata.title: Convert Kilometers per Hour to Meters per Second – Speed Converter
metadata.description: Convert speed from Kilometers per Hour (km/h) to Meters per Second (m/s), essential for physics calculations, engineering analysis, and scientific research.

introduction: This converter transforms speed measurements from Kilometers per Hour to Meters per Second, enabling translation of practical speeds to physics-based calculations.
Everyday speeds are naturally expressed in km/h, while physics equations use m/s. This conversion is essential for scientific analysis of motion.
This converter uses the precise relationship where 3.6 km/h equals exactly 1 m/s.
methodology: 3.6 km/h = 1 m/s. To convert km/h to m/s, divide by 3.6. For example, 36 km/h = 10 m/s, 72 km/h = 20 m/s, 90 km/h = 25 m/s.
Vehicle speeds measured in km/h must be converted to m/s for physics problem analysis. Understanding both units enables practical-to-scientific translation.
Impact calculations, projectile motion, and fluid dynamics all require speeds in m/s. Converting from km/h enables these calculations.
This converter provides precise speed conversions for physics, engineering, and scientific applications.
examples: Example 1 – Car speed: 36 km/h = 10 m/s, typical local speed limit.
Example 2 – Highway speed: 100 km/h = 27.8 m/s, high-speed travel.
Example 3 – Wind speed: 45 km/h = 12.5 m/s, strong wind conditions.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from km/h to m/s?
faqs.answer: Divide km/h by 3.6 to get m/s. Alternatively, multiply km/h by 0.2778.

faqs.question: Why convert speeds to m/s?
faqs.answer: Physics equations use SI units (m/s). Converting enables proper calculation of forces, energy, and motion.

faqs.question: What are everyday speeds in m/s?
faqs.answer: Walking: 1.4 m/s; Jogging: 3 m/s; Cycling: 6-8 m/s; Driving: 15-30 m/s.

glossary.definition: Practical unit of speed, standard for vehicle velocities and everyday measurements.
SI unit of velocity, used in physics and engineering calculations.
